{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3306259,"name":"Haluk A. I.","username":"haarcz","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/haarcz/{size}/213605_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-10T07:29:47.451Z","cooked":"

Hey there, we just upgraded our Limelight 3 to 2024.0 version, and we wanted to calibrate. When we took the snapshots according to the documentation and switched to calibration tab.

Then we entered the inputs and clicked “Start Calibration”. First, it outputs stuff like “Found 50 photos”, “Accepted 50 photos”, but then, the Limelight’s blinking top lights get stuck and the whole Limelight turns off. It then turns on by itself, flashing the green lights, but the calibration process is already gone.

I tried this multiple times, and everytime the same thing happened. I even reflashed the OS from balena etcher and took new photos, but nothing changed.

Did anyone also had this issue? Any ideas on how to fix? Thanks.
